values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: midX
values.comment: Get the median (central) X value of a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: midY
values.comment: Get the median (central) Y value of a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: midZ
values.comment: Get the median (central) Z value of a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: minX
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: minY
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: minZ
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: offsetBy
values.comment:
Expand or shrink the given bounding box in all the directions by the given
distance. A positive offset will cause the bounding box to expand and a negative
value will cause it to shrink.

    BoundingBox3d.offsetBy (Length.meters -0.5) exampleBox
    --> Just <|
    -->     BoundingBox3d.fromExtrema
    -->         { minX = Length.meters -1.5
    -->         , maxX = Length.meters 1.5
    -->         , minY = Length.meters 2.5
    -->         , maxY = Length.meters 4.5
    -->         , minZ = Length.meters 3.5
    -->         , maxZ = Length.meters 3.5
    -->         }

Returns `Nothing` if the offset is negative and large enough to cause the
bounding box to vanish (that is, if the offset is larger than half the height or
half the width of the bounding box, whichever is less):

    BoundingBox3d.offsetBy (Length.meters -1) exampleBox
    --> Nothing

If you only want to expand a bounding box, you can use
[`expandBy`](BoundingBox3d#expandBy) instead (which does not return a `Maybe`).
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates)

values.name: overlappingByAtLeast
values.comment:
Check two boxes overlap by at least the given amount. For example, you could
implement a tolerant collision check (one that only returns true if the boxes
overlap by at least a millimeter, and ignores boxes that just barely touch each
other) as

    boxesCollide firstBox secondBox =
        BoundingBox3d.overlappingByAtLeast
            (Length.millimeters 1)
            firstBox
            secondBox

Overlap is defined as the _minimum_ distance one box would have to move so that
it did not touch the other. Boxes that just touch are considered to have an
overlap of zero, so

    BoundingBox3d.overlappingByAtLeast Quantity.zero
        firstBox
        secondBox

will return true even if the two boxes just touch each other.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: randomPoint
values.comment:
Create a [random generator](https://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm/random/latest/Random)
for points within a given bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Random.Generator (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates)

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a bounding box about a given point by a given scale.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: separatedByAtLeast
values.comment:
Check if two boxes are separated by at least the given amount. For example,
to perform clash detection between some objects, you could use `separatedBy` on
those objects' bounding boxes as a quick check to see if the objects had a gap
of at least 1 cm between them:

    safelySeparated firstBox secondBox =
        BoundingBox3d.separatedByAtLeast
            (Length.centimeters 1)
            firstBox
            secondBox

Separation is defined as the _minimum_ distance one box would have to move so
that it touched the other. (Note that this may be a _diagonal_ distance between
corners.) Boxes that just touch are considered to have a separation of zero, so

    BoundingBox3d.separatedByAtLeast Quantity.zero
        firstBox
        secondBox

will return true even if the two boxes just touch each other.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: singleton
values.comment: Construct a zero-width bounding box containing a single point.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a bounding box by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector3d.Vector3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a bounding box in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: union
values.comment:
Build a bounding box that contains both given bounding boxes.

    firstBox =
        BoundingBox3d.from
            (Point3d.meters 1 2 0)
            (Point3d.meters 4 3 5)

    secondBox =
        BoundingBox3d.from
            (Point3d.meters -2 4 -1)
            (Point3d.meters 2 5 0)

    BoundingBox3d.union firstBox secondBox
    --> BoundingBox3d.from
    -->     (Point3d.meters -2 2 -1)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 4 5 5)

(Note that this is not strictly speaking a 'union' in the precise mathematical
sense.)
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: withDimensions
values.comment:
Construct a bounding box given its overall dimensions (length, width,
height) and center point.
values.type: ( Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units ) -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: xInterval
values.comment: Get the range of X values contained by a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units

values.name: xyz
values.comment: Construct a bounding box from separate X, Y and Z [intervals](https://package.elm-lang.org/packages/ianmackenzie/elm-units-interval/latest/).
values.type: Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: yInterval
values.comment: Get the range of Y values contained by a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units

values.name: zInterval
values.comment: Get the range of Y values contained by a bounding box.
values.type: BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Interval.Interval Basics.Float units

name: Circle2d

Convert a circle from one units type to another, by providing a conversion

units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> Circle2d.Circle2d units1 coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units2 coordinates

values.comment: Construct a circle at the origin with the given radius.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: atPoint
values.comment:
Construct a circle from its radius and center point:

    exampleCircle =
        Circle2d.atPoint (Point2d.meters 1 2)
            (Length.meters 3)

If you pass a negative radius, the absolute value will be used.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a circle from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> Circle2d.Circle2d units1 coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units2 coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Get the minimal bounding box containing a given circle.

    Circle2d.boundingBox exampleCircle
    --> BoundingBox2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters -2 -1)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 4 5)
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates

values.name: centerPoint
values.comment: Get the center point of a circle.
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: circumference
values.comment: Get the circumference (perimeter) of a circle.
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: contains
values.comment: Check if a circle contains a given point.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: diameter
values.comment: Get the diameter of a circle (twice the radius).
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: intersectsBoundingBox
values.comment:
Check if a circle intersects with a given bounding box. This function will
return true if the circle intersects the edges of the bounding box _or_ is fully
contained within the bounding box.

    boundingBox =
        BoundingBox2d.from
            (Point2d.meters 2 0)
            (Point2d.meters 3 2)

    circle =
        Circle2d.atOrigin (Length.meters 3)

    Circle2d.intersectsBoundingBox boundingBox circle
    --> True
values.type: BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a circle across a given axis.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a circle considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that circle expressed in global coordinates.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Circle2d.Circle2d units localCoordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: radius
values.comment: Get the radius of a circle.
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a circle defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Circle2d.Circle2d units globalCoordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment: Rotate a circle around a given point by a given angle.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a circle about a given point by a given scale.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: sweptAround
values.comment:
Construct a circle by rotating a point on the circle around a given center
point. The center point is given first and the point on the circle is given
second.

    Circle2d.sweptAround Point2d.origin
        (Point2d.meters 2 0)
    --> Circle2d.atOrigin (Length.meters 2)

The above example could be rewritten as

    Point2d.meters 2 0
        |> Circle2d.sweptAround Point2d.origin

and if you wanted to create many concentric circles all centered on a specific
point but passing through several other different points, you could use
something like

    concentricCircles =
        List.map (Circle2d.sweptAround centerPoint) points
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: throughPoints
values.comment:
Attempt to construct a circle that passes through the three given points:

    Circle2d.throughPoints
        Point2d.origin
        (Point2d.meters 1 0)
        (Point2d.meters 0 1)
    --> Just <|
    -->     Circle2d.atPoint (Point2d.meters 0.5 0.5)
    -->         (Length.meters 0.7071)

If the three given points are collinear, returns `Nothing`:

    Circle2d.throughPoints
        Point2d.origin
        (Point2d.meters 2 0)
        (Point2d.meters 4 0)
    --> Nothing
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates)

values.name: toArc
values.comment: Convert a circle to a 360 degree arc.
values.type: Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Geometry.Types.Arc2d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a circle by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a circle in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: withRadius
values.comment:
Construct a circle from its radius and center point. Flipped version of
`atPoint` that may be more useful in some situations like constructing a bunch
of circles of the same radius at different points:

    circles =
        List.map (Circle2d.withRadius radius) listOfPoints
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Get the minimal bounding box containing a given circle.

    Circle3d.boundingBox exampleCircle
    --> BoundingBox3d.from
    -->     (Point3d.meters -1 -3 1)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 5 3 1)
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: centerPoint
values.comment: Get the center point of a circle.
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: circumference

values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: diameter
values.comment: Get the diameter of a circle (twice its radius).
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: flip
values.comment: Flip the axial direction of a circle.
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.comment: Mirror a circle across a given plane.
values.type: Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: on
values.comment:
Construct a 3D circle lying _on_ a sketch plane by providing a 2D circle
specified in XY coordinates _within_ the sketch plane.

    Circle3d.on SketchPlane3d.yz <|
        Circle2d.withRadius (Length.meters 3)
            (Point2d.meters 1 2)
    --> Circle3d.withRadius (Length.meters 3)
    -->     Direction3d.x
    -->     (Point3d.meters 0 1 2)
values.type: SketchPlane3d.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Circle2d.Circle2d units coordinates2d -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates3d

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a circle considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that circle expressed in global coordinates.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Circle3d.Circle3d units localCoordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units globalCoordinates

values.name: plane
values.comment:
Get the plane that a circle lies in. The origin point of the returned plane
will be the center point of the circle, and its normal direction will be the
axial direction of the circle.
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates

values.name: projectInto
values.comment:
Project a circle into a sketch plane. Note that the result is in general an
ellipse, not a circle!

    inclinedCircle : Circle3d
    inclinedCircle =
        Circle3d.withRadius (Length.meters 1)
            (Direction3d.xz (Angle.degrees 45))
            (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)

    Circle3d.projectInto SketchPlane3d.xy inclinedCircle
    --> Ellipse2d.with
    -->     { centerPoint = Point2d.meters 1 2
    -->     , xDirection = Direction2d.negativeY
    -->     , xRadius = Length.meters 1
    -->     , yRadius = Length.meters 0.7071
    -->     }

The X radius of the returned ellipse will always be greater than or equal to the
Y radius (the X axis will be the major axis and the Y axis will be the minor
axis). Note that if the 3D circle is perfectly parallel to the sketch plane,
then the resulting ellipse will be circular (its X and Y radii will be equal)
and its X and Y axis directions will be chosen arbitrarily.
values.type: SketchPlane3d.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates3d -> Geometry.Types.Ellipse2d units coordinates2d

values.name: radius
values.comment: Get the radius of a circle.
values.type: Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a circle defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Circle3d.Circle3d units globalCoordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment: Rotate a circle around a given axis by a given angle.
values.type: Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a circle around a given point by a given scale.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: sweptAround
values.comment:
Construct a circle by sweeping the given point around the given axis.

    Circle3d.sweptAround Axis3d.z (Point3d.meters 3 0 2)
    --> Circle3d.withRadius (Length.meters 3)
    -->     Direction3d.z
    -->     (Point3d.meters 0 0 2)
values.type: Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: throughPoints
values.comment:
Attempt to construct a circle that passes through the three given points.
The axial direction of the returned circle will be such that the three points
are in counterclockwise order around it, according to the right-hand rule. If
the three given points are collinear, returns `Nothing`.

    Circle3d.throughPoints
        (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)
        (Point3d.meters 0 1 0)
        (Point3d.meters 0 0 1)
    --> Just <|
    -->     Circle3d.withRadius (Length.meters 0.8165)
    -->         (Direction3d.xyZ
    -->             (Angle.degrees 45)
    -->             (Angle.degrees 35.26)
    -->         )
    -->         (Point3d.meters 0.333 0.333 0.333)
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates)

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a circle by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector3d.Vector3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a circle in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: withRadius
values.comment:
Construct a circle from its radius, axial direction and center point:

    exampleCircle =
        Circle3d.withRadius (Length.meters 3)
            Direction3d.z
            (Point3d.meters 2 0 1)

If you pass a negative radius, the absolute value will be used.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

name: Cone3d

values.name: along
values.comment:
Construct a cone that lies along the given axis, with the center of the base
and tip points given as (signed) distances along that axis:

    exampleCone =
        Cone3d.along Axis3d.x
            { base = Length.meters -1
            , tip = Length.meters 3
            , radius = Length.meters 1
            }

    Cone3d.basePoint exampleCone
    --> Point3d.meters -1 0 0

    Cone3d.tipPoint exampleCone
    --> Point3d.meters 3 0 0

    Cone3d.length exampleCone
    --> Length.meters 4

Note that `tip` may be less than `base`, but then the axial direction of the
returned cone will be the opposite of the axial direction of the given axis.
values.type: Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates -> { base : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, tip : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, radius : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units } -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a cone from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> Cone3d.Cone3d units1 coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a cone from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> Cone3d.Cone3d units1 coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units2 coordinates

values.name: axialDirection
values.comment: Get the axial direction of a cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates

values.name: axis
values.comment:
Get the central axis of a cone. The origin point of the axis will be at
the center point of the base, and the direction of the axis will be from the
cone's base point towards its tip.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates

values.name: base
values.comment:
Get the circle at the base of a cone. The axial direction of this
circle will be the _reverse_ of the axial direction of the cone itself (the
circle axial direction will point backwards/outwards).
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Circle3d.Circle3d units coordinates

values.name: basePlane
values.comment:
Get the plane at the base of a cone. The normal direction of this
plane will be the same as the axial direction of the cone itself.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates

values.name: basePoint
values.comment:
Get the base point of a cone. This is the center point of the circle
that forms the base of the cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment: Get the minimal bounding box containing a given cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates

values.name: contains
values.comment: Check if a cone contains a given point.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: diameter
values.comment: Get the base diameter of a cone (twice its radius).
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: from
values.comment:
Attempt to construct a cone from the given center point on the base,
tip point and radius. If the base and tip points are coincident (the same point),
returns `Nothing`.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Maybe.Maybe (Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates)

values.name: length
values.comment: Get the overall length of a cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a cone across a given plane.
values.type: Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a cone considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that cone expressed in global coordinates.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Cone3d.Cone3d units localCoordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units globalCoordinates

values.name: radius
values.comment: Get the base radius of a cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a cone defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Cone3d.Cone3d units globalCoordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment: Rotate a cone around a given axis by a given angle.
values.type: Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a cone about a given point by a given scale.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: startingAt
values.comment:
Construct a cone given the center point on the base, axial direction
towards the tip, radius and length. Negative values for radius or length
will be treated as positive (the absolute values will be used).
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> { radius : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, length : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units } -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: tipPoint
values.comment: Get the tip point of a cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a cone by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector3d.Vector3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a cone in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates

values.name: volume
values.comment: Get the volume of a cone.
values.type: Cone3d.Cone3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Cubed units)

name: CubicSpline2d

unions.name: ArcLengthParameterized
unions.comment: A spline that has been parameterized by arc length.

unions.name: Nondegenerate
unions.comment: Represents a nondegenerate spline (one that has finite, non-zero length).

values.name: approximate
values.comment:
Approximate a cubic spline as a polyline, within a given tolerance. Every
point on the returned polyline will be within the given tolerance of the spline.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: arcLength
values.comment:
Find the total arc length of a spline, to within the accuracy given when
calling [`arcLengthParameterized`](#arcLengthParameterized).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: arcLengthParameterization
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> ArcLengthParameterization.ArcLengthParameterization units

values.name: arcLengthParameterized
values.comment:
Build an arc length parameterization of the given spline, with a given
accuracy.
values.type: { maxError : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units } -> CubicSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a spline from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units1 coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a spline from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units1 coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: bisect
values.comment:
Split a spline into two roughly equal halves. Equivalent to
`CubicSpline2d.splitAt 0.5`.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> ( CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates, CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates )

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Compute a bounding box for a given spline. It is not guaranteed that the
result will be the _smallest_ possible bounding box, since for efficiency the
bounding box is computed from the spline's control points (which cover a larger
area than the spline itself).

    CubicSpline2d.boundingBox exampleSpline
    --> BoundingBox2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 1)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 7 4)
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates

values.name: endDerivative
values.comment:
Get the end derivative of a spline. This is equal to three times the vector
from the spline's end control point to its end point.

    CubicSpline2d.endDerivative exampleSpline
    --> Vector2d.meters 6 9
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: endPoint
values.comment:
Get the end point of a spline. Equal to
[`fourthControlPoint`](#fourthControlPoint).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: firstControlPoint
values.comment:
Get the first control point of the spline. Equal to
[`startPoint`](#startPoint).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: firstDerivative
values.comment: Get the first derivative of a spline at a given parameter value.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: fourthControlPoint
values.comment:
Get the fourth and last control point of the spline.
Equal to [`endPoint`](#endPoint).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: fromArcLengthParameterized
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromControlPoints
values.comment:
Construct a spline from its four control points:

    exampleSpline =
        CubicSpline2d.fromControlPoints
            (Point2d.meters 1 1)
            (Point2d.meters 3 4)
            (Point2d.meters 5 1)
            (Point2d.meters 7 4)
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromEndpoints
values.comment:
Construct a spline from a given start point with a given start derivative,
to a given end point with a given end derivative, like so:

![Cubic spline from endpoints](https://ianmackenzie.github.io/elm-geometry/1.0.0/CubicSpline2d/fromEndpoints.svg)

The spline is based on a parameter that ranges from 0 to 1; as a result, in most
cases the length of each derivative vector should be roughly equal to the length
of the resulting spline.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromNondegenerate
values.comment: Convert a nondegenerate spline back to a general `CubicSpline2d`.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromQuadraticSpline
values.comment:
Convert a quadratic spline into the equivalent cubic spline (every quadratic
spline can be represented exactly as a cubic spline).

    quadraticSpline =
        QuadraticSpline2d.fromControlPoints
            Point2d.origin
            (Point2d.meters 3 0)
            (Point2d.meters 3 3)

    CubicSpline2d.fromQuadraticSpline quadraticSpline
    --> CubicSpline2d.fromControlPoints
    -->     Point2d.origin
    -->     (Point2d.meters 2 0)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 3 1)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 3 3)
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: maxSecondDerivativeMagnitude
values.comment:
Find a conservative upper bound on the magnitude of the second derivative of
a spline. This can be useful when determining error bounds for various kinds of
linear approximations.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: midpoint
values.comment:
Get the midpoint of a spline. Note that this is the point half way along the
spline by arc length, which is not in general the same as evaluating at a
parameter value of 0.5.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a spline across an axis.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: nondegenerate
values.comment:
Attempt to construct a nondegenerate spline from a general `CubicSpline2d`.
If the spline is in fact degenerate (consists of a single point), returns an
`Err` with that point.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Result.Result (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) (CubicSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates)

values.name: numApproximationSegments
values.comment:
Determine the number of linear segments needed to approximate a cubic
spline to within a given tolerance.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinats -> Basics.Int

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a spline considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that spline expressed in global coordinates.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units localCoordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: pointAlong
values.comment: Get the point along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: pointOn
values.comment: Get the point along a spline at a given parameter value.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a spline defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units globalCoordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units localCoordinates

values.name: reverse
values.comment:
Reverse a spline so that the start point becomes the end point, and vice
versa.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment:
Rotate a spline counterclockwise around a given center point by a given
angle.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: sample
values.comment:
Get both the point and tangent direction of a nondegenerate spline at a
given parameter value.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> ( Point2d.Point2d units coordinates, Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates )

values.name: sampleAlong
values.comment: Get the point and tangent direction along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> ( Point2d.Point2d units coordinates, Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates )

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a spline about the given center point by the given scale.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: secondControlPoint
values.comment: Get the second control point of the spline.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: secondDerivative
values.comment: Evaluate the second derivative of a spline at a given parameter value.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: segments
values.comment:
Approximate a cubic spline by a given number of line segments. Note that the
number of points in the polyline will be one more than the number of segments.
values.type: Basics.Int -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: splitAt
values.comment:
Split a spline at a particular parameter value, resulting in two smaller
splines.
values.type: Basics.Float -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> ( CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates, CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates )

values.name: startDerivative
values.comment:
Get the start derivative of a spline. This is equal to three times the
vector from the spline's start point to its start control point.

    CubicSpline2d.startDerivative exampleSpline
    --> Vector2d.meters 6 9
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: startPoint
values.comment:
Get the start point of a spline. Equal to
[`firstControlPoint`](#firstControlPoint).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: tangentDirection
values.comment:
Get the tangent direction to a nondegenerate spline at a given parameter
value.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates

values.name: tangentDirectionAlong
values.comment: Get the tangent direction along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates

values.name: thirdControlPoint
values.comment: Get the third control point of the spline.
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: thirdDerivative
values.comment:
Get the third derivative of a spline (for a cubic spline, this is a
constant).
values.type: CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a spline by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a spline in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates -> CubicSpline2d.CubicSpline2d units coordinates

values.comment:
Construct a spline from a given start point with a given start derivative,
to a given end point with a given end derivative, like so:

values.name: fromQuadraticSpline

Convert a quadratic spline into the equivalent cubic spline (every quadratic
spline can be represented exactly as a cubic spline).

    quadraticSpline =
        QuadraticSpline3d.fromControlPoints

    -->     Point3d.origin
    -->     (Point3d.meters 2 0 0)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 3 1 0)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 3 3 0)
values.type: QuadraticSpline3d.QuadraticSpline3d units coordinates -> CubicSpline3d.CubicSpline3d units coordinates

values.name: on
values.comment:
Construct a 3D spline lying _on_ a sketch plane by providing a 2D spline
specified in XY coordinates _within_ the sketch plane.

    CubicSpline3d.on SketchPlane3d.xz <|
        CubicSpline2d.fromControlPoints
            (Point2d.meters 1 1)
            (Point2d.meters 3 4)
            (Point2d.meters 5 1)
            (Point2d.meters 7 4)
    --> CubicSpline3d.fromControlPoints
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 0 1)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 3 0 4)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 5 0 1)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 7 0 4)
