    angle =
        Angle.degrees 45

    point =
        Point2d.meters 3 0

    Point2d.rotateAround centerPoint angle point
    --> Point2d.meters 2.7071 0.7071
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment:
Perform a uniform scaling about the given center point. The center point is
given first and the point to transform is given last. Points will contract or
expand about the center point by the given scale. Scaling by a factor of 1 is a
no-op, and scaling by a factor of 0 collapses all points to the center point.

    centerPoint =
        Point2d.meters 1 1

    point =
        Point2d.meters 2 3

    Point2d.scaleAbout centerPoint 3 point
    --> Point2d.meters 4 7

    Point2d.scaleAbout centerPoint 0.5 point
    --> Point2d.meters 1.5 2

Avoid scaling by a negative scaling factor - while this may sometimes do what
you want it is confusing and error prone. Try a combination of mirror and/or
rotation operations instead.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: signedDistanceAlong
values.comment:
Determine how far along an axis a particular point lies. Conceptually, the
point is projected perpendicularly onto the axis, and then the distance of this
projected point from the axis' origin point is measured. The result will be
positive if the projected point is ahead the axis' origin point and negative if
it is behind, with 'ahead' and 'behind' defined by the direction of the axis.

    axis =
        Axis2d.withDirection Direction2d.x
            (Point2d.meters 1 2)

    point =
        Point2d.meters 3 3

    Point2d.signedDistanceAlong axis point
    --> Length.meters 2

    Point2d.signedDistanceAlong axis Point2d.origin
    --> Length.meters -1
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: signedDistanceFrom
values.comment:
Find the perpendicular distance of a point from an axis. The result
will be positive if the point is to the left of the axis and negative if it is
to the right, with the forwards direction defined by the direction of the axis.

    -- A horizontal axis through a point with a Y
    -- coordinate of 2 is effectively the line Y=2
    axis =
        Axis2d.withDirection Direction2d.x
            (Point2d.meters 1 2)

    point =
        Point2d.meters 3 3

    -- Since the axis is in the positive X direction,
    -- points above the axis are to the left (positive)
    Point2d.signedDistanceFrom axis point
    -->  Length.meters 1

    -- and points below are to the right (negative)
    Point2d.signedDistanceFrom axis Point2d.origin
    --> Length.meters -2

This means that reversing an axis will also flip the sign of the result of this
function:

    -- Reversing an axis reverses its direction
    reversedAxis =
        Axis2d.reverse axis

    Point2d.signedDistanceFrom reversedAxis point
    --> Length.meters -1

    Point2d.signedDistanceFrom reversedAxis Point2d.origin
    --> Length.meters 2
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: toMeters
values.type: Point2d.Point2d Length.Meters coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float }

values.name: toPixels
values.type: Point2d.Point2d Pixels.Pixels coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float }

values.name: toRecord
values.comment:
Convert a `Point2d` to a record with `Float` fields, by specifying what units you want the
result to be in.

    point =
        Point2d.meters 2 3

    Point2d.toRecord Length.inCentimeters point
    --> { x = 200, y = 300 }
values.type: (Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Basics.Float) -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float }

values.name: toTuple
values.comment:
Convert a `Point2d` to a tuple of `Float` values, by specifying what units you want the result
to be in.

    point =
        Point2d.feet 2 3

    Point2d.toTuple Length.inInches point
    --> ( 24, 36 )
values.type: (Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Basics.Float) -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> ( Basics.Float, Basics.Float )

values.name: toUnitless
values.type: Point2d.Point2d Quantity.Unitless coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float }

values.name: translateBy
values.comment:
Translate a point by a given displacement.

    point =
        Point2d.meters 3 4

    displacement =
        Vector2d.meters 1 2

    Point2d.translateBy displacement point
    --> Point2d.meters 4 6

In more mathematical terms, this is 'point plus vector'. For 'point minus point'
(giving the vector from one point to another), there is [`Vector2d.from`](Vector2d#from).
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment:
Translate a point in a given direction by a given distance.

    point =
        Point2d.meters 3 4

    point
        |> Point2d.translateIn Direction2d.x
            (Length.meters 2)
    --> Point2d.meters 5 4

    point
        |> Point2d.translateIn Direction2d.y
            (Length.meters 2)
    --> Point2d.meters 3 6

    angledDirection =
        Direction2d.degrees 45

    point
        |> Point2d.translateIn angledDirection
            (Length.meters 1)
    --> Point2d.meters 3.7071 4.7071

The distance can be negative:

    point
        |> Point2d.translateIn Direction2d.x
            (Length.meters -2)
    --> Point2d.meters 1 4
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: unitless
values.comment:
Construct a unitless `Point2d` value from its X and Y coordinates. See also
[`fromUnitless`](#fromUnitless).
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point2d.Point2d Quantity.Unitless coordinates

values.name: unsafe
values.comment:
Construct a point from its raw X and Y coordinates as `Float` values. The
values must be in whatever units the resulting point is considered to use
(usually meters or pixels). You should generally use something safer such as
[`meters`](#meters), [`fromPixels`](#fromPixels), [`xy`](#xy),
[`fromRecord`](#fromRecord) etc.
values.type: { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float } -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: unwrap
values.comment:
Extract a point's raw X and Y coordinates as `Float` values. These values
will be in whatever units the point has (usually meters or pixels). You should
generally use something safer such as [`toMeters`](#toMeters),
[`toRecord`](#toRecord), [`xCoordinate`](#xCoordinate) etc.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float }

values.name: xCoordinate
values.comment:
Get the X coordinate of a point.

    Point2d.xCoordinate (Point2d.meters 2 3)
    --> Length.meters 2
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: xCoordinateIn
values.comment: Find the X coordinate of a point relative to a given frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point2d.Point2d units globalCoordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: xy
values.comment:
Construct a point from its X and Y coordinates.

    point =
        Point2d.xy (Length.meters 2) (Length.meters 3)
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: xyIn
values.comment:
Construct a point given its local coordinates within a particular frame:

    rotatedFrame =
        Frame2d.atOrigin
            |> Frame2d.rotateBy (Angle.degrees 45)

    Point2d.xyIn rotatedFrame
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Length.meters 0)
    --> Point2d.meters 1.4142 1.4142
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: yCoordinate
values.comment:
Get the Y coordinate of a point.

    Point2d.yCoordinate (Point2d.meters 2 3)
    --> Length.meters 3
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: yCoordinateIn
values.comment: Find the Y coordinate of a point relative to a given frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point2d.Point2d units globalCoordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

name: Point3d

values.name: along
values.comment:
Construct a point along an axis at a particular distance from the axis'
origin point.

    Point3d.along Axis3d.z (Length.meters 2)
    --> Point3d.meters 0 0 2

Positive and negative distances are interpreted relative to the direction of the
axis:

    horizontalAxis =
        Axis3d.withDirection Direction3d.negativeX
            (Point3d.meters 1 1 1)

    Point3d.along horizontalAxis (Length.meters 3)
    --> Point3d.meters -2 1 1

    Point3d.along horizontalAxis (Length.meters -3)
    --> Point3d.meters 4 1 1
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a point from one units type to another, by providing a conversion factor given as a
rate of change of destination units with respect to source units.

    worldPoint =
        Point3d.meters 2 3 1

    resolution : Quantity Float (Rate Pixels Meters)
    resolution =
        Pixels.pixels 100 |> Quantity.per (Length.meters 1)

    worldPoint |> Point3d.at resolution
    --> Point3d.pixels 200 300 100
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate destinationUnits sourceUnits) -> Point3d.Point3d sourceUnits coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d destinationUnits coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a point from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse' conversion factor
given as a rate of change of source units with respect to destination units.

    screenPoint =
        Point3d.pixels 200 300 100

    resolution : Quantity Float (Rate Pixels Meters)
    resolution =
        Pixels.pixels 50 |> Quantity.per (Length.meters 1)

    screenPoint |> Point3d.at_ resolution
    --> Point3d.meters 4 6 2
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate sourceUnits destinationUnits) -> Point3d.Point3d sourceUnits coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d destinationUnits coordinates

values.name: centimeters
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: centroid
values.comment:
Find the centroid (average) of one or more points, by passing the first
point and then all remaining points. This allows this function to return a
`Point3d` instead of a `Maybe Point3d`. You would generally use `centroid`
within a `case` expression:

    case points of
        [] ->
            -- some default behavior

        first :: rest ->
            let
                centroid =
                    Point3d.centroid first rest
            in
            ...

Alternatively, you can use [`centroidN`](#centroidN) instead.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> List.List (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates) -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: centroid3
values.comment:
Find the centroid of three points;

    Point3d.centroid3 p1 p2 p3

is equivalent to

    Point3d.centroid p1 [ p2, p3 ]

but is more efficient.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: centroidN
values.comment:
Find the centroid of a list of _N_ points. If the list is empty, returns
`Nothing`. If you know you have at least one point, you can use
[`centroid`](#centroid) instead to avoid the `Maybe`.
values.type: List.List (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates) -> Maybe.Maybe (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates)

values.name: centroidOf
values.comment:
Like `centroid`, but lets you work with any kind of data as long as a point
can be extracted/constructed from it. For example, to get the centroid of a
bunch of vertices:

    type alias Vertex =
        { position : Point3d Meters World
        , color : Color
        , id : Int
        }

    vertexCentroid =
        Point3d.centroidOf .position
            firstVertex
            [ secondVertex
            , thirdVertex
            ]
values.type: (a -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates) -> a -> List.List a -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: circumcenter
values.comment:
Attempt to find the circumcenter of three points; this is the center of the
circle that passes through all three points. If the three given points are
collinear, returns `Nothing`.

    Point3d.circumcenter
        (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)
        (Point3d.meters 0 1 0)
        (Point3d.meters 0 0 1)
    --> Just (Point3d.meters 0.33 0.33 0.33)

    Point3d.circumcenter
        Point3d.origin
        (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)
        (Point3d.meters 2 0 0)
    --> Nothing
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates)

values.name: coordinates
values.comment:
Get the X, Y and Z coordinates of a point as a tuple.

    Point3d.coordinates (Point3d.meters 2 3 1)
    --> ( Length.meters 2
    --> , Length.meters 3
    --> , Length.meters 1
    --> )
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> ( Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units )

values.name: coordinatesIn
values.comment:
Get the X, Y and Z coordinates of a point relative to a given frame, as a
tuple; these are the coordinates the point would have as viewed by an observer
in that frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates -> ( Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units, Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units )

values.name: distanceFrom
values.comment:
Find the distance from the first point to the second.

    Point3d.distanceFrom
        (Point3d.meters 1 1 2)
        (Point3d.meters 2 3 4)
    --> Length.meters 3

Partial application can be useful:

    points =
        [ Point3d.meters 3 4 5
        , Point3d.meters 10 10 10
        , Point3d.meters -1 2 -3
        ]

    points
        |> Quantity.sortBy
            (Point3d.distanceFrom Point3d.origin)
    --> [ Point3d.meters -1 2 -3
    --> , Point3d.meters 3 4 5
    --> , Point3d.meters 10 10 10
    --> ]
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: distanceFromAxis
values.comment:
Find the perpendicular (nearest) distance of a point from an axis.

    point =
        Point3d.meters -3 4 0

    Point3d.distanceFromAxis Axis3d.x point
    --> Length.meters 4

    Point3d.distanceFromAxis Axis3d.y point
    --> Length.meters 3

    Point3d.distanceFromAxis Axis3d.z point
    --> Length.meters 5

Note that unlike in 2D, the result is always positive (unsigned) since there is
no such thing as the left or right side of an axis in 3D.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: equalWithin
values.comment:
Compare two points within a tolerance. Returns true if the distance
between the two given points is less than the given tolerance.

    firstPoint =
        Point3d.meters 2 1 3

    secondPoint =
        Point3d.meters 2.0002 0.9999 3.0001

    Point3d.equalWithin (Length.millimeters 1)
        firstPoint
        secondPoint
    --> True

    Point3d.equalWithin (Length.microns 1)
        firstPoint
        secondPoint
    --> False
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: feet
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: fromMeters
values.type: { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float } -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: fromPixels
values.type: { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float } -> Point3d.Point3d Pixels.Pixels coordinates

values.name: fromRecord
values.comment:
Construct a `Point3d` from a record with `Float` fields, by specifying what
units those fields are in.

    Point3d.fromRecord Length.inches
        { x = 24, y = 36, z = 12 }
    --> Point3d.feet 2 3 1
values.type: (Basics.Float -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units) -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float } -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: fromTuple
values.comment:
Construct a `Point3d` from a tuple of `Float` values, by specifying what units those values are
in.

    Point3d.fromTuple Length.meters ( 2, 3, 1 )
    --> Point3d.meters 2 3 1
values.type: (Basics.Float -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units) -> ( Basics.Float, Basics.Float, Basics.Float ) -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: fromUnitless
values.type: { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float } -> Point3d.Point3d Quantity.Unitless coordinates

values.name: inches
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: interpolateFrom
values.comment:
Construct a point by interpolating from the first given point to the second,
based on a parameter that ranges from zero to one.

    startPoint =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 4

    endPoint =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 8

    Point3d.interpolateFrom startPoint endPoint 0.25
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 5

Partial application may be useful:

    interpolatedPoint : Float -> Point3d
    interpolatedPoint =
        Point3d.interpolateFrom startPoint endPoint

    List.map interpolatedPoint [ 0, 0.5, 1 ]
    --> [ Point3d.meters 1 2 4
    --> , Point3d.meters 1 2 6
    --> , Point3d.meters 1 2 8
    --> ]

You can pass values less than zero or greater than one to extrapolate:

    interpolatedPoint -0.5
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 2

    interpolatedPoint 1.25
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 9
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: lexicographicComparison
values.comment:
Compare two `Point3d` values lexicographically: first by X coordinate, then
by Y, then by Z. Can be used to provide a sort order for `Point3d` values.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Order

values.name: meters
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: midpoint
values.comment:
Construct a point halfway between two other points.

    Point3d.midpoint
        (Point3d.meters 1 1 1)
        (Point3d.meters 3 7 9)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 4 5
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: millimeters
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment:
Mirror a point across a plane. The result will be the same distance from the
plane but on the opposite side.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 3

    -- Plane3d.xy is the plane Z=0
    Point3d.mirrorAcross Plane3d.xy point
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 -3

    -- Plane3d.yz is the plane X=0
    Point3d.mirrorAcross Plane3d.yz point
    --> Point3d.meters -1 2 3

The plane does not have to pass through the origin:

    -- offsetPlane is the plane  Z=1
    offsetPlane =
        Plane3d.offsetBy 1 Plane3d.xy

    -- The origin point is 1 unit below the offset
    -- plane, so its mirrored copy is one unit above
    Point3d.mirrorAcross offsetPlane Point3d.origin
    --> Point3d.meters 0 0 2
values.type: Geometry.Types.Plane3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: on
values.comment:
Construct a 3D point lying _on_ a sketch plane by providing a 2D point
specified in XY coordinates _within_ the sketch plane.

    Point3d.on SketchPlane3d.xy (Point2d.meters 2 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 1 0

    Point3d.on SketchPlane3d.xz (Point2d.meters 2 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 0 1

The sketch plane can have any position and orientation:

    tiltedSketchPlane =
        SketchPlane3d.xy
            |> SketchPlane3d.rotateAround Axis3d.x
                (Angle.degrees 45)
            |> SketchPlane3d.moveTo
                (Point3d.meters 10 10 10)

    Point3d.on tiltedSketchPlane (Point2d.meters 2 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 12 10.7071 10.7071
values.type: Geometry.Types.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates2d -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates3d

values.name: origin
values.comment: The point with coordinates (0, 0, 0).
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: pixels
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Pixels.Pixels coordinates

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a point defined in local coordinates relative to a given reference
frame, and return that point expressed in global coordinates.

    localFrame =
        Frame3d.atPoint (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)

    Point3d.placeIn localFrame (Point3d.meters 3 3 3)
    --> Point3d.meters 4 5 6

    Point3d.placeIn localFrame (Point3d.meters 0 -1 -2)
    --> Point3d.meters 1 1 1
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units localCoordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates

values.name: projectInto
values.comment:
Project a point into a given sketch plane. Conceptually, this finds the
[orthographic projection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection)
of the point onto the plane and then expresses the projected point in 2D sketch
coordinates.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 2 1 3

    Point3d.projectInto SketchPlane3d.xy point
    --> Point2d.meters 2 1

    Point3d.projectInto SketchPlane3d.yz point
    --> Point2d.meters 1 3

    Point3d.projectInto SketchPlane3d.zx point
    --> Point2d.meters 3 2
values.type: Geometry.Types.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates3d -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates2d

values.name: projectOnto
values.comment:
Find the [orthographic projection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection)
of a point onto a plane:

    point =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 3

    Point3d.projectOnto Plane3d.xy point
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 0

    Point3d.projectOnto Plane3d.yz point
    --> Point3d.meters 0 2 3

The plane does not have to pass through the origin:

    offsetPlane =
        Plane3d.offsetBy 1 Plane3d.xy

    Point3d.projectOnto offsetPlane point
    --> Point3d.meters 1 2 1
values.type: Geometry.Types.Plane3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: projectOntoAxis
values.comment:
Project a point perpendicularly onto an axis.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 3

    Point3d.projectOntoAxis Axis3d.x
    --> Point3d.meters 1 0 0

    verticalAxis =
        Axis3d.withDirection Direction3d.z
            (Point3d.meters 0 1 2)

    Point3d.projectOntoAxis verticalAxis
    --> Point3d.meters 0 1 3
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: rThetaOn
values.comment:
Construct a 3D point lying on a sketch plane by providing its 2D polar
coordinates within that sketch plane:

    Point3d.rThetaOn SketchPlane3d.xy
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Angle.degrees 45)
    --> Point3d.meters 1.4142 1.4142 0

    Point3d.rThetaOn SketchPlane3d.yz
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Angle.degrees 30)
    --> Point3d.meters 0 1.732 1
values.type: Geometry.Types.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Angle.Angle -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a point defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in local
coordinates relative to a given reference frame.

    localFrame =
        Frame3d.atPoint (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)

    Point3d.relativeTo localFrame (Point3d.meters 4 5 6)
    --> Point3d.meters 3 3 3

    Point3d.relativeTo localFrame (Point3d.meters 1 1 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 0 -1 -2
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment:
Rotate a point around an axis by a given angle.

    axis =
        Axis3d.x

    angle =
        Angle.degrees 45

    point =
        Point3d.meters 3 1 0

    Point3d.rotateAround axis angle point
    --> Point3d.meters 3 0.7071 0.7071

Rotation direction is given by the right-hand rule, counterclockwise around the
direction of the axis.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis3d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment:
Perform a uniform scaling about the given center point. The center point is
given first and the point to transform is given last. Points will contract or
expand about the center point by the given scale. Scaling by a factor of 1 is a
no-op, and scaling by a factor of 0 collapses all points to the center point.

    centerPoint =
        Point3d.meters 1 1 1

    point =
        Point3d.meters 1 2 3

    Point3d.scaleAbout centerPoint 3 point
    --> Point3d.meters 1 4 7

    Point3d.scaleAbout centerPoint 0.5 point
    --> Point3d.meters 1 1.5 2

Avoid scaling by a negative scaling factor - while this may sometimes do what
you want it is confusing and error prone. Try a combination of mirror and/or
rotation operations instead.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: signedDistanceAlong
values.comment:
Determine how far along an axis a particular point lies. Conceptually, the
point is projected perpendicularly onto the axis, and then the distance of this
projected point from the axis' origin point is measured. The result will be
positive if the projected point is ahead the axis' origin point and negative if
it is behind, with 'ahead' and 'behind' defined by the direction of the axis.

    axis =
        Axis3d.withDirection Direction3d.x
            (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)

    Point3d.signedDistanceAlong axis (Point3d.meters 3 3 3)
    --> Length.meters 2

    Point3d.signedDistanceAlong axis Point3d.origin
    --> Length.meters -1
values.type: Geometry.Types.Axis3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: signedDistanceFrom
values.comment:
Find the perpendicular distance of a point from a plane. The result will be
positive if the point is 'above' the plane and negative if it is 'below', with
'up' defined by the normal direction of the plane.

    plane =
        Plane3d.withNormalDirection Direction3d.y
            (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)

    Point3d.signedDistanceFrom plane (Point3d.meters 3 3 3)
    --> Length.meters 1

    Point3d.signedDistanceFrom plane Point3d.origin
    --> Length.meters -2

This means that flipping a plane (reversing its normal direction) will also flip
the sign of the result of this function:

    flippedPlane =
        Plane3d.reverseNormal plane

    Point3d.signedDistanceFrom flippedPlane point
    --> Length.meters -1

    Point3d.signedDistanceFrom flippedPlane Point3d.origin
    --> Length.meters 2
values.type: Geometry.Types.Plane3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: toMeters
values.type: Point3d.Point3d Length.Meters coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: toPixels
values.type: Point3d.Point3d Pixels.Pixels coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: toRecord
values.comment:
Convert a `Point3d` to a record with `Float` fields, by specifying what units you want the
result to be in.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 2 3 1

    Point3d.toRecord Length.inCentimeters point
    --> { x = 200, y = 300, z = 100 }
values.type: (Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Basics.Float) -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: toTuple
values.comment:
Convert a `Point3d` to a tuple of `Float` values, by specifying what units you want the result
to be in.

    point =
        Point3d.feet 2 3 1

    Point3d.toTuple Length.inInches point
    --> ( 24, 36, 12 )
values.type: (Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Basics.Float) -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> ( Basics.Float, Basics.Float, Basics.Float )

values.name: toUnitless
values.type: Point3d.Point3d Quantity.Unitless coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: translateBy
values.comment:
Translate a point by a given displacement.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 3 4 5

    displacement =
        Vector3d.meters 1 2 3

    Point3d.translateBy displacement point
    --> Point3d.meters 4 6 8

In more mathematical terms, this is 'point plus vector'. For 'point minus point'
(giving the vector from one point to another), there is [`Vector3d.from`](Vector3d#from).
values.type: Vector3d.Vector3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment:
Translate a point in a given direction by a given distance.

    point =
        Point3d.meters 3 4 5

    point
        |> Point3d.translateIn Direction3d.x
            (Length.meters 2)
    --> Point3d.meters 5 4 5

    point
        |> Point3d.translateIn Direction3d.y
            (Length.meters 2)
    --> Point3d.meters 3 6 5

The distance can be negative:

    point
        |> Point3d.translateIn Direction3d.x
            (Length.meters -2)
    --> Point3d.meters 1 4 5
values.type: Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: unitless
values.comment:
Construct a unitless `Point3d` value from its X, Y and Z coordinates. See
also [`fromUnitless`](#fromUnitless).
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Point3d.Point3d Quantity.Unitless coordinates

values.name: unsafe
values.comment:
Construct a point from its raw X, Y and Z coordinates as `Float` values. The
values must be in whatever units the resulting point is considered to use
(usually meters or pixels). You should generally use something safer such as
[`meters`](#meters), [`fromPixels`](#fromPixels), [`xyz`](#xyz),
[`fromRecord`](#fromRecord) etc.
values.type: { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float } -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: unwrap
values.comment:
Extract a point's raw X, Y and Z coordinates as `Float` values. These values
will be in whatever units the point has (usually meters or pixels). You should
generally use something safer such as [`toMeters`](#toMeters),
[`toRecord`](#toRecord), [`xCoordinate`](#xCoordinate) etc.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: xCoordinate
values.comment:
Get the X coordinate of a point.

    Point3d.xCoordinate (Point3d.meters 2 1 3)
    --> Length.meters 2
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: xCoordinateIn
values.comment: Find the X coordinate of a point relative to a given frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: xyOn
values.comment:
Construct a 3D point lying on a sketch plane by providing its 2D coordinates
within that sketch plane:

    Point3d.xyOn SketchPlane3d.xy
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Length.meters 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 1 0

    Point3d.xyOn SketchPlane3d.xz
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Length.meters 1)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 0 1
values.type: Geometry.Types.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: xyz
values.comment:
Construct a point from its X, Y and Z coordinates.

    point =
        Point3d.xyz
            (Length.meters 2)
            (Length.meters 1)
            (Length.meters 3)
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units coordinates

values.name: xyzIn
values.comment:
Construct a point given its local coordinates within a particular frame:

    frame =
        Frame3d.atPoint (Point3d.meters 1 1 1)

    Point3d.xyzIn frame
        (Length.meters 1)
        (Length.meters 2)
        (Length.meters 3)
    --> Point3d.meters 2 3 4
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates

values.name: yCoordinate
values.comment:
Get the Y coordinate of a point.

    Point3d.yCoordinate (Point3d.meters 2 1 3)
    --> Length.meters 1
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: yCoordinateIn
values.comment: Find the Y coordinate of a point relative to a given frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: zCoordinate
values.comment:
Get the Z coordinate of a point.

    Point3d.zCoordinate (Point3d.meters 2 1 3)
    --> Length.meters 3
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: zCoordinateIn
values.comment: Find the Z coordinate of a point relative to a given frame.
values.type: Geometry.Types.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Point3d.Point3d units globalCoordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

name: Polygon2d

unions.name: TriangulationRule
unions.comment:
A `TriangulationRule` controls the polygon triangulation process and
determines how large the faces/edges are in the resulting triangular mesh.

values.name: area
values.comment:
Get the area of a polygon. This value will never be negative.

    Polygon2d.area squareWithHole
    --> Area.squareMeters 8
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Squared units)

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a polygon from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units1 coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a polygon from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units1 coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units2 coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Get the minimal bounding box containing a given polygon. Returns `Nothing`
if the polygon has no vertices.

    Polygon2d.boundingBox rectangle
    --> Just <|
    -->     BoundingBox2d.from
    -->         (Point2d.meters 1 1)
    -->         (Point2d.meters 3 2)
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates)

values.name: centroid
values.comment:
Get the centroid of a polygon. Returns `Nothing` if the polygon has no
vertices or zero area.
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: contains
values.comment:
Check if a polygon contains a given point.

This is an O(n) operation. The polygon can have holes and does not need to be convex.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Basics.Bool

values.name: convexHull
values.comment:
Build the [convex hull](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convex_hull) of a list
of points:

![Convex hull of a set of points](https://ianmackenzie.github.io/elm-geometry/1.0.0/Polygon2d/convexHull.svg)

This is an O(n log n) operation.
values.type: List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: edgeSubdivisions
values.comment:
Provide a callback function that takes as input two points and returns the
minimum number of subdivisions (how many individual edges) should be used along
a line between those two points. For example, `maxEdgeLength` is implemented
roughly as:

    maxEdgeLength length =
        Polygon2d.edgeSubdivisions <|
            \start end ->
                let
                    distance =
                        Point2d.distanceFrom start end
                in
                ceiling (Quantity.ratio distance length)

The actual number of subdivisions used may be higher; as of this writing the
current implementation will round the returned value up to a power of two.
values.type: (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Int) -> Polygon2d.TriangulationRule units coordinates

values.name: edges
values.comment:
Get all edges of a polygon. This will include both outer edges and inner
(hole) edges.
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> List.List (LineSegment2d.LineSegment2d units coordinates)

values.name: innerLoops
values.comment:
Get the holes (if any) of a polygon, each defined by a list of vertices.
Each list of vertices will be in clockwise order.

    Polygon2d.innerLoops squareWithHole
    --> [ [ Point2d.meters 1 1
    -->   , Point2d.meters 1 2
    -->   , Point2d.meters 2 2
    -->   , Point2d.meters 2 1
    -->   ]
    --> ]
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> List.List (List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates))

values.name: maxEdgeLength
values.comment: Ensure that no edge in a triangulation is longer than the given length.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Polygon2d.TriangulationRule units coordinates

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment:
Mirror a polygon across the given axis. The order of the polygon's vertices
will be reversed so that the resulting polygon still has its outer vertices in
counterclockwise order and its inner vertices in clockwise order.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: outerLoop
values.comment:
Get the list of vertices definining the outer loop (border) of a polygon.
The vertices will be in counterclockwise order.

    Polygon2d.outerLoop squareWithHole
    --> [ Point2d.meters 0 0
    --> , Point2d.meters 3 0
    --> , Point2d.meters 3 3
    --> , Point2d.meters 0 3
    --> ]
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: perimeter
values.comment:
Get the perimeter of a polygon (the sum of the lengths of its edges). This
includes the outer perimeter and the perimeter of any holes.

    Polygon2d.perimeter squareWithHole
    --> Length.meters 16
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a polygon considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that polygon expressed in global coordinates.
If the given frame is left-handed, the order of the polygon's vertices will be
reversed so that the resulting polygon still has its outer vertices in
counterclockwise order and its inner vertices in clockwise order.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units localCoordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a polygon defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame. If the given frame is
left-handed, the order of the polygon's vertices will be reversed so that the
resulting polygon still has its outer vertices in counterclockwise order and its
inner vertices in clockwise order.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units globalCoordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment:
Rotate a polygon around the given center point counterclockwise by the given
angle.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment:
Scale a polygon about a given center point by a given scale. If the given
scale is negative, the order of the polygon's vertices will be reversed so that
the resulting polygon still has its outer vertices in counterclockwise order and
its inner vertices in clockwise order.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: singleLoop
values.comment:
Construct a polygon without holes from a list of its vertices:

    rectangle =
        Polygon2d.singleLoop
            [ Point2d.meters 1 1
            , Point2d.meters 3 1
            , Point2d.meters 3 2
            , Point2d.meters 1 2
            ]

The last vertex is implicitly considered to be connected back to the first
vertex (you do not have to close the polygon explicitly). Vertices should
ideally be provided in counterclockwise order; if they are provided in clockwise
order they will be reversed.
values.type: List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a polygon by the given displacement.
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a polygon in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

values.name: triangulate
values.comment:
Triangulate a polygon. This uses the `TriangularMesh` data types from
[`ianmackenzie/elm-triangular-mesh`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/ianmackenzie/elm-triangular-mesh/latest).
Triangulation is useful for things like WebGL rendering; you can define a
polygon just by specifying its outline (and holes, if it has any)

![Polygon with hole](https://ianmackenzie.github.io/elm-geometry/1.0.0/Polygon2d/triangulate1.svg)

then use this function to turn that polygon into a list of triangles which you
can render using WebGL:

![Polygon with hole](https://ianmackenzie.github.io/elm-geometry/1.0.0/Polygon2d/triangulate2.svg)
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> TriangularMesh.TriangularMesh (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: triangulateWith
values.comment:
Triangulate a polygon with additional control over the size of the triangles
in the end result. For example, to triangulate a given polygon while making sure
that every resulting triangle edge was no more than 10 centimeters long, you
could use:

    Polygon2d.triangulateWith
        (Polygon2d.maxEdgeLength (Length.centimeters 10))
        polygon

Note that this means that existing polygon edges may be split into smaller ones,
and new vertices will likely end up being added inside the polygon. Also note
that the resulting triangles may still be very thin; no particular attempt is
made to avoid large or small angles in triangles.
values.type: Polygon2d.TriangulationRule units coordinates -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> TriangularMesh.TriangularMesh (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: vertices
values.comment:
Get all vertices of a polygon; this will include vertices from the outer
loop of the polygon and all inner loops. The order of the returned vertices is
undefined.
values.type: Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates -> List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: withHoles
values.comment:
Construct a polygon with holes from one outer loop and a list of inner
loops. The loops must not touch or intersect each other.

    outerLoop =
        [ Point2d.meters 0 0
        , Point2d.meters 3 0
        , Point2d.meters 3 3
        , Point2d.meters 0 3
        ]

    innerLoop =
        [ Point2d.meters 1 1
        , Point2d.meters 1 2
        , Point2d.meters 2 2
        , Point2d.meters 2 1
        ]

    squareWithHole =
        Polygon2d.withHoles [ innerLoop ] outerLoop

As with `Polygon2d.singleLoop`, the last vertex of each loop is considered to be
connected back to the first. Vertices of the outer loop should ideally be
provided in counterclockwise order and vertices of the inner loops should
ideally be provided in clockwise order.
values.type: List.List (List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)) -> List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) -> Polygon2d.Polygon2d units coordinates

name: Polyline2d

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a polyline from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units1 coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a polyline from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units1 coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Get the minimal bounding box containing a given polyline. Returns `Nothing`
if the polyline has no vertices.

    Polyline2d.boundingBox stepShape
    --> Just <|
    -->     BoundingBox2d.from
    -->         (Point2d.meters 0 0)
    -->         (Point2d.meters 2 1)
values.type: Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates)

values.name: centroid
values.comment:
Find the centroid (center of mass) of a polyline. This is the
length-weighted average of the edges of the polyline, _not_ the centroid of its
vertices. Returns `Nothing` if the polyline is empty (has no vertices).

    Polyline2d.centroid stepShape
    --> Just (Point2d.meters 1.0 0.5)
values.type: Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

values.name: fromVertices
values.comment:
Construct a polyline from a list of vertices:

    stepShape =
        Polyline2d.fromVertices
            [ Point2d.meters 0 0
            , Point2d.meters 1 0
            , Point2d.meters 1 1
            , Point2d.meters 2 1
            ]
values.type: List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: length
values.comment:
Get the overall length of a polyline (the sum of the lengths of its
segments).

    Polyline2d.length stepShape
    --> Length.meters 3
values.type: Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: mapVertices
values.comment:
Transform each vertex of a polyline by the given function. All other
transformations can be defined in terms of `mapVertices`; for example,

    Polyline2d.mirrorAcross axis

is equivalent to

    Polyline2d.mapVertices (Point2d.mirrorAcross axis)
values.type: (Point2d.Point2d units1 coordinates1 -> Point2d.Point2d units2 coordinates2) -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units1 coordinates1 -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units2 coordinates2

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a polyline across the given axis.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a polyline considered to be defined in local coordinates relative
to a given reference frame, and return that polyline expressed in global
coordinates.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units localCoordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: projectOnto
values.comment: Project (flatten) a polyline onto the given axis.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a polyline defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed
in local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units globalCoordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment:
Rotate a polyline around the given center point counterclockwise by the
given angle.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a polyline about a given center point by a given scale.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: segments
values.comment:
Get the individual segments of a polyline.

    Polyline2d.segments stepShape
    --> [ LineSegment2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters 0 0)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 0)
    --> , LineSegment2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 0)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 1)
    --> , LineSegment2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 1)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 2 1)
    --> ]
values.type: Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> List.List (LineSegment2d.LineSegment2d units coordinates)

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a polyline by the given displacement.
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a polyline in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: vertices
values.comment: Get the vertices of a polyline.
values.type: Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates -> List.List (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates)

name: Polyline3d

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a polyline from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units1 coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a polyline from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units1 coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units2 coordinates

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Get the minimal bounding box containing a given polyline. Returns `Nothing`
if the polyline has no vertices.

    Polyline3d.boundingBox examplePolyline
    --> Just <|
    -->     BoundingBox3d.from
    -->         (Point3d.meters 0 0 0)
    -->         (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)
values.type: Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (BoundingBox3d.BoundingBox3d units coordinates)

values.name: centroid
values.comment:
Find the centroid (center of mass) of a polyline. This is the
length-weighted average of the edges of the polyline, _not_ the centroid of its
vertices. Returns `Nothing` if the polyline is empty (has no vertices).

    Polyline3d.centroid examplePolyline
    --> Just (Point3d.meters 0.9167 1.333 0.75)
values.type: Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Maybe.Maybe (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates)

values.name: fromVertices
values.comment:
Construct a polyline from its vertices:

    examplePolyline =
        Polyline3d.fromVertices
            [ Point3d.meters 0 0 0
            , Point3d.meters 1 0 0
            , Point3d.meters 1 2 0
            , Point3d.meters 1 2 3
            ]
values.type: List.List (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates) -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: length
values.comment:
Get the overall length of a polyline (the sum of the lengths of its
segments).

    Polyline3d.length examplePolyline
    --> Length.meters 6
values.type: Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: mapVertices
values.comment:
Transform each vertex of a polyline by the given function. All other
transformations can be defined in terms of `mapVertices`; for example,

    Polyline3d.mirrorAcross plane

is equivalent to

    Polyline3d.mapVertices (Point3d.mirrorAcross plane)
values.type: (Point3d.Point3d units1 coordinates1 -> Point3d.Point3d units2 coordinates2) -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units1 coordinates1 -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units2 coordinates2

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a polyline across the given plane.
values.type: Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: on
values.comment:
Construct a 3D polyline lying _on_ a sketch plane by providing a 2D polyline
specified in XY coordinates _within_ the sketch plane.

    Polyline3d.on SketchPlane3d.yz <|
        Polyline2d.fromVertices
            [ Point2d.meters 0 0
            , Point2d.meters 1 0
            , Point2d.meters 1 1
            , Point2d.meters 2 1
            ]
    --> Polyline3d.fromVertices
    -->     [ Point3d.meters 0 0 0
    -->     , Point3d.meters 0 1 0
    -->     , Point3d.meters 0 1 1
    -->     , Point3d.meters 0 2 1
    -->     ]
values.type: SketchPlane3d.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates2d -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates3d

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a polyline considered to be defined in local coordinates relative
to a given reference frame, and return that polyline expressed in global
coordinates.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units localCoordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units globalCoordinates

values.name: projectInto
values.comment: Project a polyline into a given sketch plane.
values.type: SketchPlane3d.SketchPlane3d units coordinates3d { defines : coordinates2d } -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates3d -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates2d

values.name: projectOnto
values.comment:
Find the [orthographic projection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthographic_projection)
of a polyline onto a plane. This will flatten the polyline.
values.type: Plane3d.Plane3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a polyline defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed
in local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame3d.Frame3d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units globalCoordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units localCoordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment: Rotate a polyline around the given axis by the given angle.
values.type: Axis3d.Axis3d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a polyline about the given center point by the given scale.
values.type: Point3d.Point3d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: segments
values.comment:
Get the individual segments of a polyline.

    Polyline3d.segments examplePolyline
    --> [ LineSegment3d.from
    -->     (Point3d.meters 0 0 0)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)
    --> , LineSegment3d.from
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 0 0)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 2 0)
    --> , LineSegment3d.from
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 2 0)
    -->     (Point3d.meters 1 2 3)
    --> ]
values.type: Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> List.List (LineSegment3d.LineSegment3d units coordinates)

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a polyline by the given displacement.
values.type: Vector3d.Vector3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a polyline in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction3d.Direction3d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates

values.name: vertices
values.comment: Get the vertices of a polyline.
values.type: Polyline3d.Polyline3d units coordinates -> List.List (Point3d.Point3d units coordinates)

name: QuadraticSpline2d

unions.name: ArcLengthParameterized
unions.comment: A spline that has been parameterized by arc length.

unions.name: Nondegenerate
unions.comment: Represents a nondegenerate spline (one that has finite, non-zero length).

values.name: approximate
values.comment:
Approximate a quadratic spline as a polyline, within a given tolerance.
Every point on the returned polyline will be within the given tolerance of the
spline.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: arcLength
values.comment:
Find the total arc length of a spline, to within the accuracy specified
when calling `arcLengthParameterized`.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units

values.name: arcLengthParameterization
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> ArcLengthParameterization.ArcLengthParameterization units

values.name: arcLengthParameterized
values.comment:
Build an arc length parameterization of the given spline, with a given
accuracy.
values.type: { maxError : Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units } -> QuadraticSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates

values.name: at
values.comment:
Convert a spline from one units type to another, by providing a conversion
factor given as a rate of change of destination units with respect to source
units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units2 units1) -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units1 coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: at_
values.comment:
Convert a spline from one units type to another, by providing an 'inverse'
conversion factor given as a rate of change of source units with respect to
destination units.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float (Quantity.Rate units1 units2) -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units1 coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units2 coordinates

values.name: bisect
values.comment:
Split a spline into two roughly equal halves. Equivalent to
`QuadraticSpline2d.splitAt 0.5`.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> ( QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates, QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates )

values.name: boundingBox
values.comment:
Compute a bounding box for a given spline. It is not guaranteed that the
result will be the _smallest_ possible bounding box, since for efficiency the
bounding box is computed from the spline's control points (which cover a larger
area than the spline itself).

    QuadraticSpline2d.boundingBox exampleSpline
    --> BoundingBox2d.from
    -->     (Point2d.meters 1 1)
    -->     (Point2d.meters 5 4)
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> BoundingBox2d.BoundingBox2d units coordinates

values.name: endDerivative
values.comment:
Get the end derivative of a spline. This is equal to twice the vector from
the spline's second control point to its third.

    QuadraticSpline2d.endDerivative exampleSpline
    --> Vector2d.meters 4 -6
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: endPoint
values.comment: Get the end point of a spline. Equal to [`thirdControlPoint`](#thirdControlPoint).
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: firstControlPoint
values.comment: Get the first control point of a spline. Equal to [`startPoint`](#startPoint).
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: firstDerivative
values.comment:
Get the first derivative of a spline at a given parameter value. Note that
the derivative interpolates linearly from end to end.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: fromArcLengthParameterized
values.comment:
Get the original `QuadraticSpline2d` from which an `ArcLengthParameterized`
value was constructed.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromControlPoints
values.comment:
Construct a spline from its start point, inner control point and end point:

    exampleSpline =
        QuadraticSpline2d.fromControlPoints
            (Point2d.meters 1 1)
            (Point2d.meters 3 4)
            (Point2d.meters 5 1)
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: fromNondegenerate
values.comment: Convert a nondegenerate spline back to a general `QuadraticSpline2d`.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: midpoint
values.comment:
Get the midpoint of a spline. Note that this is the point half way along the
spline by arc length, which is not in general the same as evaluating at a
parameter value of 0.5.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: mirrorAcross
values.comment: Mirror a spline across an axis.
values.type: Axis2d.Axis2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: nondegenerate
values.comment:
Attempt to construct a nondegenerate spline from a general
`QuadraticSpline2d`. If the spline is in fact degenerate (consists of a single
point), returns an `Err` with that point.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Result.Result (Point2d.Point2d units coordinates) (QuadraticSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates)

values.name: numApproximationSegments
values.comment:
Determine the number of linear segments needed to approximate a quadratic
spline to within a given tolerance.
values.type: Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinats -> Basics.Int

values.name: placeIn
values.comment:
Take a spline considered to be defined in local coordinates relative to a
given reference frame, and return that spline expressed in global coordinates.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units localCoordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units globalCoordinates

values.name: pointAlong
values.comment: Get the point along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: pointOn
values.comment: Get the point along a spline at a given parameter value.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: relativeTo
values.comment:
Take a spline defined in global coordinates, and return it expressed in
local coordinates relative to a given reference frame.
values.type: Frame2d.Frame2d units globalCoordinates { defines : localCoordinates } -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units globalCoordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units localCoordinates

values.name: reverse
values.comment:
Reverse a spline so that the start point becomes the end point, and vice
versa.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: rotateAround
values.comment:
Rotate a spline counterclockwise around a given center point by a given
angle.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Angle.Angle -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: sample
values.comment:
Get both the point and tangent direction of a nondegenerate spline at a
given parameter value.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> ( Point2d.Point2d units coordinates, Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates )

values.name: sampleAlong
values.comment: Get the point and tangent direction along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> ( Point2d.Point2d units coordinates, Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates )

values.name: scaleAbout
values.comment: Scale a spline about the given center point by the given scale.
values.type: Point2d.Point2d units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: secondControlPoint
values.comment: Get the second control point of a spline.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: secondDerivative
values.comment:
Get the second derivative of a spline (for a quadratic spline, this is a
constant).
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: segments
values.comment:
Approximate a quadratic spline by a given number of line segments. Note that
the number of points in the polyline will be one more than the number of
segments.
values.type: Basics.Int -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Polyline2d.Polyline2d units coordinates

values.name: splitAt
values.comment:
Split a spline at a particular parameter value, resulting in two smaller
splines.
values.type: Basics.Float -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> ( QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates, QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates )

values.name: startDerivative
values.comment:
Get the start derivative of a spline. This is equal to twice the vector from
the spline's first control point to its second.

    QuadraticSpline2d.startDerivative exampleSpline
    --> Vector2d.meters 4 6
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates

values.name: startPoint
values.comment: Get the start point of a spline. Equal to [`firstControlPoint`](#firstControlPoint).
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: tangentDirection
values.comment:
Get the tangent direction to a nondegenerate spline at a given parameter
value.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.Nondegenerate units coordinates -> Basics.Float -> Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates

values.name: tangentDirectionAlong
values.comment: Get the tangent direction along a spline at a given arc length.
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.ArcLengthParameterized units coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates

values.name: thirdControlPoint
values.comment: Get the third and last control point of a spline. Equal to [`endPoint`](#endPoint).
values.type: QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> Point2d.Point2d units coordinates

values.name: translateBy
values.comment: Translate a spline by a given displacement.
values.type: Vector2d.Vector2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates

values.name: translateIn
values.comment: Translate a spline in a given direction by a given distance.
values.type: Direction2d.Direction2d coordinates -> Quantity.Quantity Basics.Float units -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates -> QuadraticSpline2d.QuadraticSpline2d units coordinates
